name: Masala Dosa
description: A crispy rice pancake filled with spicy potato masala , a popular South Indian breakfast.
ingredients: rice, urad dal, fenugreek seeds, potatoes, onions, green chilies, mustard seeds, curry leaves
instructions: 1. Soak rice, urad dal, and fenugreek seeds overnight. 2. Grind the soaked ingredients into a smooth batter and ferment for 8 hours. 3. For the masala, boil potatoes and mash. 4. Heat oil, add mustard seeds, curry leaves, onions, and green chilies; sauté until onions are golden. 5. Add the mashed potatoes, salt, and turmeric; mix well. 6. Pour a ladle of batter on a hot griddle, spread thin, drizzle oil, and cook until crispy. 7. Place potato filling in the center, fold dosa, and serve hot with chutney and sambar.

name: Idli
description: Steamed rice cakes made with a fermented rice and lentil batter, soft and fluffy.
ingredients: rice, urad dal, fenugreek seeds
instructions: 1. Soak rice, urad dal, and fenugreek seeds overnight. 2. Grind into a smooth batter and ferment for 8 hours. 3. Grease idli molds with oil. 4. Pour batter into the molds, steam in an idli steamer for 10-12 minutes. 5. Serve hot with coconut chutney and sambar.

name: Sambar
description: A tangy and spicy lentil and vegetable stew, typically served with rice or as a side for breakfast items.
ingredients: toor dal, tamarind, carrots, beans, onions, tomatoes, mustard seeds, curry leaves, sambar powder
instructions: 1. Rinse and pressure cook toor dal until soft. 2. Soak tamarind in water, extract juice. 3. Heat oil, add mustard seeds and curry leaves; sauté until they splutter. 4. Add chopped onions and tomatoes; cook until soft. 5. Add vegetables, sambar powder, and tamarind juice; simmer until veggies are tender. 6. Mix in cooked dal, add water as needed for consistency, and simmer for 10 more minutes. 7. Garnish with coriander and serve.

name: Vada
description: A deep-fried savory snack made with a spiced urad dal batter, crispy on the outside and soft inside.
ingredients: urad dal, green chilies, ginger, curry leaves, black peppercorns, onions
instructions: 1. Soak urad dal for 2-3 hours. 2. Grind into a thick batter, adding little water if needed. 3. Mix in chopped onions, chilies, ginger, curry leaves, and black pepper. 4. Heat oil in a deep pan. 5. Wet your hands, take a small portion of batter, shape into a round, and make a hole in the center. 6. Gently slide into hot oil and fry until golden brown. 7. Drain on paper towels and serve hot with coconut chutney.

name: Rasam
description: A tangy and spiced soup made with tamarind and tomatoes, seasoned with traditional spices.
ingredients: tamarind, tomatoes, black pepper, cumin seeds, curry leaves, mustard seeds, coriander leaves
instructions: 1. Soak tamarind in water and extract juice. 2. Blend tomatoes into a pulp. 3. Heat oil, add mustard seeds, cumin seeds, and curry leaves; sauté until they splutter. 4. Add tomato pulp, tamarind juice, salt, and turmeric. 5. Add black pepper powder, simmer for 5-10 minutes. 6. Garnish with coriander leaves and serve hot with rice.

name: Pongal
description: A comforting South Indian dish made from rice and moong dal, often served for breakfast.
ingredients: rice, moong dal, ghee, black pepper, cumin seeds, curry leaves, ginger, cashews
instructions: 1. Rinse rice and moong dal, and dry roast dal lightly. 2. Pressure cook rice and dal with water until soft. 3. Heat ghee, add black pepper, cumin seeds, curry leaves, ginger, and cashews. 4. Pour tempering over cooked rice-dal mixture, mix well, and serve hot.

name: Avial
description: A nutritious vegetable curry cooked in coconut and yogurt, typically served as a side dish.
ingredients: carrots, beans, pumpkin, coconut, yogurt, green chilies, curry leaves
instructions: 1. Chop vegetables and steam them until tender. 2. Grind coconut, green chilies, and cumin seeds into a paste. 3. Add paste and yogurt to cooked vegetables, mix well. 4. Garnish with curry leaves and serve.

name: Upma
description: A savory semolina dish with vegetables, a common South Indian breakfast.
ingredients: semolina, onions, green chilies, mustard seeds, curry leaves, ginger
instructions: 1. Roast semolina in a dry pan until golden, set aside. 2. Heat oil, add mustard seeds, curry leaves, and green chilies. 3. Add onions and ginger, sauté until onions are translucent. 4. Add water, bring to a boil, add roasted semolina slowly, stirring continuously. 5. Cook until water is absorbed, serve hot.

name: Bisi Bele Bath
description: A spicy rice and lentil dish from Karnataka, similar to a risotto with tamarind and spices.
ingredients: rice, toor dal, tamarind, carrots, beans, sambar powder
instructions: 1. Pressure cook rice and toor dal with water. 2. Soak tamarind and extract juice. 3. Heat oil, add chopped vegetables, sauté. 4. Add tamarind juice, sambar powder, and cooked rice-dal mixture, stir well. 5. Simmer for 10-15 minutes, garnish with coriander leaves and serve hot.

name: Vada
description: A deep-fried savory snack made with spiced urad dal batter, crispy outside and soft inside.
ingredients: urad dal, green chilies, ginger, curry leaves, black pepper, onions
instructions: 1. Soak urad dal for 2-3 hours. 2. Grind into thick batter, adding little water. 3. Mix in onions, chilies, ginger, curry leaves, and pepper. 4. Shape into rounds, fry in hot oil until golden. 5. Serve hot with coconut chutney.

name: Paruppu Usili
description: A protein-rich dish made with crumbled lentils and vegetables, usually served as a side.
ingredients: toor dal, chana dal, green beans, curry leaves, red chilies
instructions: 1. Soak toor and chana dal for 1 hour, then grind coarsely. 2. Steam ground dal mixture until cooked. 3. Crumble dal and stir-fry with cooked green beans, red chilies, and curry leaves. 4. Serve as a side with rice.

name: Pesarattu
description: A green gram dosa, crispy and healthy, often served with ginger chutney.
ingredients: green gram, ginger, green chilies, rice flour, cumin seeds
instructions: 1. Soak green gram overnight, then grind with ginger and chilies. 2. Add cumin seeds, rice flour, and water to form a batter. 3. Pour batter onto a hot pan, spread thin, drizzle oil, cook until crispy. 4. Serve with ginger chutney.

name: Kootu
description: A vegetable and lentil stew made with coconut, a healthy side dish option.
ingredients: chayote, moong dal, coconut, cumin seeds, green chilies, curry leaves
instructions: 1. Pressure cook moong dal and chayote until soft. 2. Grind coconut, cumin seeds, and chilies to a paste. 3. Add paste to cooked dal and chayote, simmer. 4. Garnish with curry leaves and serve.

name: Chettinad Egg Curry
description: A spicy egg curry cooked with Chettinad spices, rich in flavor and texture.
ingredients: eggs, onions, tomatoes, fennel seeds, curry leaves, coconut, Chettinad masala
instructions: 1. Boil eggs, remove shells, set aside. 2. Heat oil, add fennel seeds, curry leaves, onions, and tomatoes; cook until soft. 3. Add Chettinad masala, coconut paste, cook until oil separates. 4. Add boiled eggs, simmer for 5 minutes, serve hot with rice.

name: Dosa
description: A thin, crispy pancake made from a fermented rice and lentil batter, a South Indian favorite.
ingredients: rice, urad dal, fenugreek seeds, ghee
instructions: 1. Soak rice, urad dal, and fenugreek seeds overnight. 2. Grind into a smooth batter and ferment for 8 hours. 3. Heat pan, pour batter, spread thin, drizzle ghee, cook until crispy. 4. Serve hot with sambar and chutney.

name: Methi Thepla
description: A soft, spiced flatbread made with fresh fenugreek leaves, a popular Gujarati snack.
ingredients: wheat flour, fenugreek leaves, yogurt, green chilies, turmeric, cumin seeds
instructions: 1. Mix wheat flour, chopped fenugreek leaves, yogurt, spices, and water to form dough. 2. Roll into thin circles and cook on a hot pan with a little oil until golden. 3. Serve hot with yogurt or pickle.

name: Coconut Rice
description: A fragrant South Indian rice dish with fresh grated coconut, ideal for a light lunch.
ingredients: rice, grated coconut, mustard seeds, curry leaves, green chilies, cashews
instructions: 1. Cook rice and set aside to cool slightly. 2. Heat oil, add mustard seeds, curry leaves, green chilies, and cashews. 3. Add grated coconut, sauté briefly, then mix with cooked rice. 4. Serve warm.

name: Masala Dosa
description: A crispy rice pancake filled with spicy potato masala, a popular South Indian breakfast.
ingredients: rice, urad dal, fenugreek seeds, potatoes, onions, green chilies, mustard seeds, curry leaves
instructions: 1. Soak rice, urad dal, and fenugreek seeds overnight. 2. Grind into batter, ferment for 8 hours. 3. Prepare filling with mashed potatoes, spices, and onions. 4. Pour batter on a hot pan, spread thin, add filling, fold, and serve.

name: Puliyodarai
description: A tangy tamarind-flavored rice dish from South India, often served as prasadam.
ingredients: rice, tamarind, mustard seeds, peanuts, red chilies, curry leaves
instructions: 1. Soak tamarind, extract juice, and set aside. 2. Cook rice, cool slightly. 3. Heat oil, add mustard seeds, peanuts, red chilies, and curry leaves. 4. Add tamarind juice, cook until thick, then mix with rice and serve.

name: Kappa and Meen Curry
description: A Kerala specialty with boiled tapioca and spicy fish curry, often served as a main dish.
ingredients: tapioca, fish, coconut, red chilies, tamarind, curry leaves, turmeric
instructions: 1. Boil tapioca until soft, set aside. 2. Grind coconut and red chilies to paste. 3. Heat oil, add spices and tamarind, cook fish until done. 4. Serve hot with boiled tapioca.

name: Thakkali Sadam
description: A tangy tomato rice flavored with spices, a quick and delicious lunch option.
ingredients: rice, tomatoes, mustard seeds, curry leaves, green chilies, turmeric
instructions: 1. Cook rice and set aside. 2. Sauté mustard seeds, curry leaves, and green chilies. 3. Add chopped tomatoes and spices, cook until soft. 4. Mix with rice and serve warm.

name: Kootu Curry
description: A traditional Kerala curry with vegetables and black chickpeas, often served during feasts.
ingredients: yam, raw banana, black chickpeas, coconut, cumin, mustard seeds
instructions: 1. Cook black chickpeas until tender. 2. Cook yam and banana with turmeric. 3. Grind coconut and cumin to paste, add to vegetables and chickpeas. 4. Temper with mustard seeds and serve.

name: Chettinad Chicken Curry
description: A spicy and aromatic chicken curry from Chettinad, rich in bold flavors.
ingredients: chicken, onions, tomatoes, curry leaves, Chettinad masala, coconut
instructions: 1. Heat oil, add onions, tomatoes, and curry leaves, cook until soft. 2. Add Chettinad masala and coconut paste, cook until oil separates. 3. Add chicken, simmer until tender. 4. Serve hot with rice or roti.

name: Gobi Manchurian
description: A popular Indo-Chinese dish with crispy cauliflower florets in a spicy sauce.
ingredients: cauliflower, flour, corn flour, garlic, soy sauce, green chilies, spring onions
instructions: 1. Coat cauliflower florets in flour batter, fry until crispy. 2. Sauté garlic, green chilies, and spring onions. 3. Add soy sauce and fried cauliflower, toss well. 4. Serve hot garnished with spring onions.

name: Aloo Gobi Curry
description: A simple yet flavorful curry with potatoes and cauliflower, a staple in Indian cuisine.
ingredients: potatoes, cauliflower, tomatoes, cumin seeds, turmeric, green chilies, coriander
instructions: 1. Heat oil, add cumin seeds, green chilies, and turmeric. 2. Add potatoes and cauliflower, cook until tender. 3. Add tomatoes and coriander, cook until well mixed. 4. Serve hot with rice or roti.

name: Vegetable Upma
description: A light and healthy South Indian breakfast made from semolina and mixed vegetables.
ingredients: semolina, carrots, peas, onions, mustard seeds, curry leaves, green chilies
instructions: 1. Dry roast semolina and set aside. 2. Heat oil, add mustard seeds, curry leaves, and green chilies. 3. Sauté onions and mixed vegetables. 4. Add water, bring to boil, then add semolina. 5. Stir until thickened and serve hot.

name: Chickpea Sundal
description: A South Indian chickpea salad with coconut and spices, often enjoyed as a snack or festival offering.
ingredients: chickpeas, grated coconut, mustard seeds, curry leaves, green chilies
instructions: 1. Boil chickpeas until tender. 2. Heat oil, add mustard seeds, curry leaves, and green chilies. 3. Add chickpeas, sauté briefly, then mix in grated coconut. 4. Serve warm.

name: Rasam
description: A spicy and tangy South Indian soup made with tomatoes, tamarind, and spices.
ingredients: tomatoes, tamarind, mustard seeds, cumin, pepper, curry leaves, coriander
instructions: 1. Soak tamarind and extract juice. 2. Boil tomatoes and spices with tamarind juice. 3. Temper with mustard seeds and curry leaves. 4. Garnish with coriander and serve hot.

name: Methi Malai Murg
description: A creamy North Indian chicken curry with fenugreek and cream, mildly spiced.
ingredients: chicken, fresh fenugreek leaves, cream, onions, garlic, ginger
instructions: 1. Heat oil, sauté onions, ginger, and garlic. 2. Add chicken, cook until lightly browned. 3. Add fenugreek leaves, spices, and cream. 4. Simmer until chicken is tender and serve hot.

name: Pongal
description: A comforting South Indian rice and lentil dish seasoned with ghee and black pepper.
ingredients: rice, split yellow moong dal, black pepper, cumin, ghee, curry leaves
instructions: 1. Dry roast moong dal, then rinse with rice. 2. Cook rice and dal with water until soft. 3. Heat ghee, add black pepper, cumin, and curry leaves. 4. Mix seasoning into rice-dal mixture and serve hot.

name: Vendakkai Poriyal
description: A simple stir-fried okra dish with mild spices, perfect as a side.
ingredients: okra, mustard seeds, turmeric, curry leaves, onions
instructions: 1. Heat oil, add mustard seeds and curry leaves. 2. Add sliced okra and turmeric, sauté until tender. 3. Add onions, cook until translucent, and serve hot.

name: Mysore Pak
description: A rich and traditional South Indian sweet made with gram flour, ghee, and sugar.
ingredients: gram flour, sugar, ghee
instructions: 1. Heat ghee in a pan, add gram flour, cook until golden. 2. Add sugar syrup, stir until mixture thickens. 3. Pour into a tray, let cool, then cut into squares and serve.

name: Nannari Sharbat
description: A refreshing herbal drink made from Nannari roots, perfect for hot days.
ingredients: nannari root syrup, lemon juice, ice, water
instructions: 1. Add Nannari syrup to water and lemon juice. 2. Stir well, add ice, and serve chilled.

name: Chili Chicken
description: A spicy Indo-Chinese stir-fried chicken dish with bell peppers and onions.
ingredients: chicken, bell peppers, onions, soy sauce, green chilies, garlic
instructions: 1. Marinate chicken with spices, then fry until golden. 2. Sauté garlic, onions, bell peppers, and green chilies. 3. Add soy sauce, mix in chicken, toss well, and serve hot.

name: Curd Rice
description: A soothing South Indian dish made with rice and yogurt, typically served as a cooling meal.
ingredients: rice, yogurt, curry leaves, mustard seeds, green chilies
instructions: 1. Cook rice and cool slightly. 2. Mix with yogurt. 3. Temper mustard seeds, curry leaves, and green chilies, add to rice. 4. Serve chilled or at room temperature.

name: Medu Vada
description: A savory South Indian fritter made from urad dal, crisp on the outside and soft on the inside.
ingredients: urad dal, green chilies, ginger, curry leaves, peppercorns
instructions: 1. Soak urad dal for 4 hours, grind to a smooth batter. 2. Add chopped chilies, ginger, curry leaves, and peppercorns. 3. Shape batter into rings, deep-fry until golden. 4. Serve hot with chutney.

name: Paruppu Vada
description: A crispy South Indian snack made from chana dal, flavored with spices.
ingredients: chana dal, onions, green chilies, curry leaves
instructions: 1. Soak chana dal for 2 hours, grind coarsely. 2. Mix in chopped onions, chilies, and curry leaves. 3. Shape into patties and deep-fry until golden. 4. Serve with coconut chutney.

name: Puzhi Kulambu
description: A tangy and spicy South Indian tamarind-based curry with spices.
ingredients: tamarind, mustard seeds, fenugreek, curry leaves, turmeric, vegetables (optional)
instructions: 1. Soak tamarind in water and extract juice. 2. Heat oil, add mustard seeds, fenugreek, and curry leaves. 3. Add tamarind juice, turmeric, salt, and simmer until thickened. 4. Serve hot with rice.

name: Mor Kulambu
description: A South Indian yogurt-based curry with mild spices, usually served with rice.
ingredients: yogurt, turmeric, green chilies, curry leaves, cumin
instructions: 1. Whisk yogurt with water and turmeric. 2. Temper with green chilies, curry leaves, and cumin. 3. Add yogurt mixture, simmer briefly. 4. Serve hot with rice.

name: Kuzhi Paniyaram
description: A small, round savory snack made from fermented batter, similar to idli but cooked in a special pan.
ingredients: idli batter, onions, green chilies, curry leaves
instructions: 1. Mix chopped onions, chilies, and curry leaves into batter. 2. Pour batter into greased paniyaram pan molds. 3. Cook until golden, turning once. 4. Serve with chutney.

name: Egg Thokku
description: A spicy South Indian egg dish with a thick tomato and onion gravy.
ingredients: eggs, tomatoes, onions, green chilies, turmeric, curry leaves
instructions: 1. Boil eggs, peel, and set aside. 2. Sauté onions, tomatoes, and green chilies until soft. 3. Add turmeric and salt, cook until thickened. 4. Add boiled eggs, coat with masala, and serve hot.

name: South Indian Fish Curry
description: A tangy and spicy fish curry with tamarind, coconut, and spices.
ingredients: fish, tamarind, coconut milk, mustard seeds, curry leaves
instructions: 1. Marinate fish with salt and turmeric. 2. Heat oil, add mustard seeds and curry leaves. 3. Add tamarind juice, coconut milk, and spices, simmer. 4. Add fish, cook until done, and serve hot.

name: Bisi Bele Bath
description: A traditional South Indian rice and lentil dish with vegetables and spices, served hot.
ingredients: rice, toor dal, tamarind, mixed vegetables, curry leaves, bisi bele powder
instructions: 1. Cook rice and dal until soft. 2. Add tamarind extract, cooked vegetables, and spices. 3. Simmer until thick, garnish with curry leaves, and serve hot.

name: Semiya Upma
description: A quick and light South Indian breakfast made from vermicelli and vegetables.
ingredients: vermicelli, carrots, peas, mustard seeds, curry leaves
instructions: 1. Roast vermicelli until golden and set aside. 2. Sauté mustard seeds, curry leaves, and vegetables. 3. Add water, bring to a boil, add vermicelli, cook until water absorbs. 4. Serve hot.

name: Sambar Rice
description: A comforting combination of rice and sambar with vegetables, a staple South Indian meal.
ingredients: rice, toor dal, tamarind, mixed vegetables, sambar powder
instructions: 1. Cook rice and dal until soft. 2. Prepare sambar with tamarind, vegetables, and spices. 3. Mix sambar with rice and serve hot with ghee.

name: Lemon Rice
description: A tangy and aromatic South Indian rice dish seasoned with lemon juice and spices.
ingredients: rice, lemon juice, mustard seeds, turmeric, curry leaves
instructions: 1. Cook rice and cool slightly. 2. Heat oil, add mustard seeds, turmeric, and curry leaves. 3. Mix in rice, add lemon juice, stir well, and serve.

name: Tomato Rice
description: A flavorful South Indian rice dish made with tomatoes and spices.
ingredients: rice, tomatoes, onions, green chilies, mustard seeds, curry leaves
instructions: 1. Cook rice and set aside. 2. Sauté onions, tomatoes, green chilies, and spices. 3. Add rice, mix well, and serve hot.

name: Idli Podi
description: A spiced powder made from lentils and spices, traditionally eaten with idli and dosa.
ingredients: chana dal, urad dal, sesame seeds, red chilies, asafoetida
instructions: 1. Dry roast chana dal, urad dal, sesame seeds, and red chilies. 2. Grind with salt and asafoetida to a coarse powder. 3. Store in an airtight container and serve with idli or dosa.

name: Veg Kurma
description: A mixed vegetable curry with coconut and spices, a popular South Indian side dish for rice or bread.
ingredients: mixed vegetables (carrot, beans, potato), coconut, green chilies, ginger, garlic, garam masala
instructions: 1. Grind coconut, green chilies, ginger, and garlic to a paste. 2. Sauté onions, add vegetables, and cook with spices. 3. Add coconut paste and water, simmer until vegetables are tender. 4. Serve hot with rice or bread.

name: Coconut Rice
description: A fragrant South Indian rice dish with coconut, curry leaves, and spices.
ingredients: rice, grated coconut, mustard seeds, curry leaves, green chilies
instructions: 1. Cook rice and cool slightly. 2. Sauté mustard seeds, curry leaves, and chilies, add coconut. 3. Mix in rice, stir well, and serve.

name: Cabbage Vada
description: A crispy and savory vada made with cabbage, spices, and lentils, perfect as a snack or side dish.
ingredients: cabbage, chana dal, onions, green chilies, curry leaves
instructions: 1. Soak chana dal for 2 hours, grind coarsely. 2. Mix in chopped cabbage, onions, and chilies. 3. Shape into patties and deep-fry until golden. 4. Serve with chutney.

name: Wheat Dosa
description: A quick and healthy South Indian dosa made from wheat flour, a lighter alternative to rice dosa.
ingredients: wheat flour, green chilies, onions, curry leaves
instructions: 1. Mix wheat flour with water to form a batter. 2. Add chopped onions, chilies, and curry leaves. 3. Pour batter on a hot griddle, cook until golden. 4. Serve with chutney or sambar.

name: Pudina Chutney (Mint Chutney)
description: A refreshing chutney made with mint, green chilies, and spices, typically served with South Indian snacks.
ingredients: mint leaves, green chilies, tamarind, salt
instructions: 1. Blend mint leaves, green chilies, tamarind, and salt to a smooth paste. 2. Adjust seasoning and serve with snacks.

name: Aval Laddu (Poha Ladoo)
description: A sweet Indian treat made from poha (flattened rice), ghee, and jaggery, flavored with cardamom.
ingredients: poha, jaggery, ghee, cardamom powder
instructions: 1. Roast poha until crisp, grind coarsely. 2. Mix with melted jaggery, ghee, and cardamom powder. 3. Shape into small balls, serve as a dessert.

name: Capsicum Rice
description: A colorful South Indian rice dish with capsicum and spices, easy to make and flavorful.
ingredients: rice, capsicum, onions, green chilies, mustard seeds, curry leaves
instructions: 1. Cook rice and set aside. 2. Sauté mustard seeds, curry leaves, onions, and capsicum. 3. Mix in rice, stir well, and serve hot.

name: Carrot Rice
description: A mild and nutritious South Indian rice dish with grated carrots and spices.
ingredients: rice, grated carrot, mustard seeds, green chilies, curry leaves
instructions: 1. Cook rice and cool slightly. 2. Sauté mustard seeds, curry leaves, and chilies, add grated carrot. 3. Mix in rice, stir well, and serve.

name: Beetroot Rice
description: A vibrant South Indian rice dish with grated beetroot and spices, full of nutrients.
ingredients: rice, grated beetroot, mustard seeds, green chilies, curry leaves
instructions: 1. Cook rice and cool slightly. 2. Sauté mustard seeds, curry leaves, and chilies, add grated beetroot. 3. Mix in rice, stir well, and serve.

name: Cauliflower Pakoda (Gobi Pakora)
description: A crispy and spicy snack made with cauliflower florets dipped in spiced batter and deep-fried.
ingredients: cauliflower, chickpea flour, rice flour, red chili powder, turmeric
instructions: 1. Mix chickpea flour, rice flour, chili powder, and turmeric. 2. Dip cauliflower florets in batter, deep-fry until golden. 3. Serve hot with chutney.

name: Beetroot Chutney
description: A unique South Indian chutney made with beetroot and spices, adding color and flavor to meals.
ingredients: beetroot, coconut, green chilies, tamarind, curry leaves
instructions: 1. Grind beetroot, coconut, green chilies, and tamarind to a paste. 2. Sauté in oil with curry leaves, serve with rice or dosa.

name: Chicken 65
description: A spicy and crispy South Indian fried chicken dish, often served as an appetizer.
ingredients: chicken, yogurt, ginger-garlic paste, red chili powder, curry leaves
instructions: 1. Marinate chicken with yogurt, ginger-garlic paste, and spices. 2. Deep-fry until crispy. 3. Garnish with curry leaves and serve hot.

name: Beerakaya Fry
description: A simple and nutritious stir-fry made with ridge gourd and spices, commonly enjoyed as a side dish in South India.
ingredients: ridge gourd, onions, green chilies, mustard seeds, curry leaves
instructions: 1. Peel and slice ridge gourd. 2. Sauté mustard seeds, curry leaves, onions, and green chilies. 3. Add ridge gourd, cook until tender. 4. Season and serve hot.

name: Veg Cutlet
description: A crispy and savory snack made with mixed vegetables and spices, coated in breadcrumbs and fried.
ingredients: potatoes, carrots, peas, breadcrumbs, green chilies, ginger-garlic paste
instructions: 1. Boil and mash vegetables. 2. Mix with spices and shape into patties. 3. Coat with breadcrumbs and fry until golden. 4. Serve hot with ketchup.

name: Chicken Cutlet
description: A crispy and flavorful cutlet made with minced chicken, spices, and breadcrumbs, perfect as a snack.
ingredients: minced chicken, onions, green chilies, ginger-garlic paste, breadcrumbs
instructions: 1. Sauté onions, green chilies, and ginger-garlic paste. 2. Add minced chicken, cook until done. 3. Shape into patties, coat with breadcrumbs, and fry. 4. Serve hot with chutney.

name: Boiled Egg Fry
description: A quick and spicy fried egg dish, perfect as a snack or side.
ingredients: boiled eggs, red chili powder, turmeric, salt
instructions: 1. Slice boiled eggs in half. 2. Sprinkle with chili powder, turmeric, and salt. 3. Shallow fry until golden. 4. Serve hot.

name: Egg Roast (Roasted Eggs)
description: A spicy dish of boiled eggs roasted with onions and spices, popular in South Indian cuisine.
ingredients: boiled eggs, onions, tomatoes, red chili powder, garam masala
instructions: 1. Sauté onions and tomatoes with spices. 2. Add boiled eggs and roast until well coated. 3. Serve with rice or bread.

name: Kozhukattai
description: Steamed rice dumplings filled with sweet coconut and jaggery, a traditional South Indian delicacy.
ingredients: rice flour, grated coconut, jaggery, cardamom powder
instructions: 1. Prepare dough with rice flour and water. 2. Fill with coconut, jaggery, and cardamom. 3. Shape into dumplings and steam. 4. Serve warm.

name: Oats Chilla
description: A savory pancake made with oats, vegetables, and spices, perfect for a healthy breakfast.
ingredients: oats, onions, tomatoes, green chilies, cumin seeds
instructions: 1. Grind oats to a powder, mix with water, vegetables, and spices. 2. Pour batter onto a hot pan and cook both sides. 3. Serve hot with chutney.

name: Moong Dal
description: A simple and nutritious lentil dish with moong dal, often served with rice or bread.
ingredients: moong dal, turmeric, green chilies, cumin seeds
instructions: 1. Cook moong dal with turmeric. 2. Temper with cumin seeds and green chilies. 3. Garnish and serve hot.

name: Savory French Toast
description: A quick and savory twist on French toast with spices, perfect for breakfast.
ingredients: bread, eggs, green chilies, onions, salt
instructions: 1. Beat eggs with salt, onions, and chilies. 2. Dip bread slices and fry on a pan. 3. Serve hot with ketchup.

name: Mooli Paratha
description: A stuffed Indian flatbread with spiced radish filling, a nutritious meal or snack.
ingredients: wheat flour, grated radish, green chilies, cumin seeds
instructions: 1. Prepare dough with wheat flour. 2. Stuff with spiced radish filling, roll into parathas. 3. Cook on a griddle until golden. 4. Serve with yogurt.

name: Gobi Paratha
description: A stuffed Indian flatbread with spiced cauliflower filling, a popular meal in North India.
ingredients: wheat flour, grated cauliflower, green chilies, cumin seeds
instructions: 1. Prepare dough with wheat flour. 2. Stuff with spiced cauliflower filling, roll into parathas. 3. Cook on a griddle until golden. 4. Serve with yogurt.

name: Poha
description: A light and healthy flattened rice dish with spices, vegetables, and peanuts, popular in Indian breakfasts.
ingredients: poha (flattened rice), onions, green chilies, peanuts, curry leaves
instructions: 1. Rinse poha and drain. 2. Sauté onions, green chilies, peanuts, and curry leaves. 3. Add poha, mix well, and serve hot.

name: Bread Upma (Bread Poha)
description: A quick and tasty dish made with bread and spices, similar to traditional upma, making it perfect for breakfast.
ingredients: bread, onions, green chilies, mustard seeds, curry leaves, peas
instructions: 1. Cut the bread into small pieces. 2. Heat oil in a pan, add mustard seeds and curry leaves. 3. Sauté onions and green chilies until soft. 4. Add peas and cook for 2-3 minutes. 5. Mix in the bread pieces, toss well, and cook for another 5 minutes. 6. Serve hot.

name: Rava Idli
description: Soft and fluffy steamed cakes made from semolina, ideal for breakfast or as a snack, often served with sambar and chutney.
ingredients: semolina, yogurt, mustard seeds, curry leaves, green chilies, ginger
instructions: 1. In a bowl, mix semolina, yogurt, and water to form a thick batter. 2. Let it rest for 30 minutes. 3. Add mustard seeds, curry leaves, chopped green chilies, and ginger to the batter. 4. Grease the idli molds and pour the batter into them. 5. Steam for 15-20 minutes until a toothpick comes out clean. 6. Serve with sambar and coconut chutney.

name: Aloo Paratha
description: A delicious stuffed flatbread made with spiced potato filling, commonly served with yogurt or pickle.
ingredients: whole wheat flour, potatoes, green chilies, cumin seeds, coriander leaves
instructions: 1. Boil and mash the potatoes. 2. Mix with chopped green chilies, cumin seeds, and coriander leaves. 3. Prepare dough from whole wheat flour. 4. Divide the dough and filling into equal portions. 5. Roll out the dough, place the filling in the center, and fold the dough over it. 6. Roll again into a flat shape and cook on a hot griddle until golden brown on both sides. 7. Serve with yogurt or pickle.

name: Poori
description: Fluffy, deep-fried bread made from whole wheat flour, perfect as a side dish or for breakfast with curries or subzis.
ingredients: whole wheat flour, water, salt, oil for frying
instructions: 1. In a bowl, mix whole wheat flour and salt, then add water to form a smooth dough. 2. Cover and let it rest for 15-20 minutes. 3. Heat oil in a deep frying pan. 4. Divide the dough into small balls and roll them into thin circles. 5. Carefully slide them into hot oil and fry until puffed and golden. 6. Drain on paper towels and serve hot with curry or subzi.

name: Strawberry Milkshake
description: A refreshing and creamy milkshake made with fresh strawberries, milk, and ice cream, perfect for a sweet treat.
ingredients: fresh strawberries, milk, ice cream, sugar
instructions: 1. Wash and hull the strawberries. 2. In a blender, combine strawberries, milk, sugar, and ice cream. 3. Blend until smooth and creamy. 4. Pour into glasses and serve immediately, garnished with whole strawberries.

name: Millet Dosa
description: A nutritious and crispy dosa made from millet flour, a healthy alternative to traditional rice dosas, perfect for breakfast.
ingredients: millet flour, rice flour, urad dal, fenugreek seeds, water
instructions: 1. Soak urad dal and fenugreek seeds in water for 4-5 hours. 2. Grind with millet flour and rice flour to form a smooth batter. 3. Let the batter ferment overnight. 4. Heat a non-stick skillet, pour a ladle of batter, and spread into a circle. 5. Cook until golden brown on both sides. 6. Serve with chutney or sambar.

name: Ragi Dosa
description: A healthy and gluten-free dosa made from ragi flour, packed with nutrients and perfect for breakfast or a snack.
ingredients: ragi flour, rice flour, urad dal, water
instructions: 1. Soak urad dal in water for 4-5 hours. 2. Grind the dal with ragi flour and rice flour to make a smooth batter. 3. Add water to achieve the desired consistency. 4. Heat a pan, pour batter to form a circle, and cook until crisp. 5. Serve with coconut chutney or sambar.

name: Uttapam
description: A thick, pancake-like dosa topped with vegetables, a filling and nutritious breakfast option.
ingredients: rice flour, urad dal, onions, tomatoes, green chilies, bell peppers
instructions: 1. Soak rice and urad dal for 4-5 hours and grind to a smooth batter. 2. Let the batter ferment overnight. 3. Heat a pan and pour a ladle of batter to form a thick pancake. 4. Top with chopped onions, tomatoes, green chilies, and bell peppers. 5. Cook until the bottom is golden and flip to cook the other side. 6. Serve hot with chutney.

name: Overnight Oats with Chia Seeds
description: A nutritious and easy-to-make breakfast that you prepare the night before, packed with fiber and omega-3 fatty acids.
ingredients: rolled oats, chia seeds, almond milk, honey, fresh fruits
instructions: 1. In a mason jar, combine rolled oats, chia seeds, and almond milk. 2. Add honey and mix well. 3. Top with fresh fruits like berries or sliced banana. 4. Cover and refrigerate overnight. 5. In the morning, stir well and enjoy cold or warmed up.

name: Greek Yogurt Parfait with Berries
description: A delicious and healthy layered dessert or breakfast made with Greek yogurt, fresh berries, and granola.
ingredients: Greek yogurt, mixed berries, granola, honey
instructions: 1. In a glass, layer Greek yogurt, a handful of mixed berries, and a sprinkle of granola. 2. Repeat the layers until the glass is full. 3. Drizzle honey on top. 4. Serve immediately for a refreshing breakfast.

name: Avocado Toast with Poached Eggs
description: A creamy and satisfying breakfast featuring ripe avocado on toasted bread topped with perfectly poached eggs.
ingredients: whole grain bread, ripe avocado, eggs, salt, pepper, lemon juice
instructions: 1. Toast the whole grain bread until golden brown. 2. While toasting, poach the eggs in simmering water for about 3-4 minutes. 3. In a bowl, mash the ripe avocado and mix in salt, pepper, and lemon juice. 4. Spread the avocado mixture on the toasted bread. 5. Top with poached eggs and season with extra salt and pepper. 6. Serve immediately.

name: Smoothie Bowl with Spinach and Banana
description: A vibrant and nutritious smoothie bowl made with spinach, banana, and topped with your favorite fruits and seeds.
ingredients: spinach, banana, almond milk, chia seeds, fresh fruits, granola
instructions: 1. In a blender, combine spinach, banana, and almond milk. 2. Blend until smooth and creamy. 3. Pour the smoothie into a bowl. 4. Top with fresh fruits, chia seeds, and granola. 5. Enjoy with a spoon for a nutritious breakfast.

name: Quinoa Breakfast Bowl with Almonds and Honey
description: A hearty and filling breakfast bowl made with cooked quinoa, almonds, and drizzled with honey for sweetness.
ingredients: quinoa, almond milk, almonds, honey, fresh fruits
instructions: 1. Cook quinoa according to package instructions. 2. In a bowl, combine cooked quinoa and almond milk. 3. Drizzle with honey and top with chopped almonds and fresh fruits. 4. Mix well and enjoy warm or cold.

name: Veggie Omelette with Spinach and Bell Peppers
description: A fluffy and healthy omelette loaded with fresh vegetables, perfect for a protein-packed breakfast.
ingredients: eggs, spinach, bell peppers, onions, salt, pepper
instructions: 1. Whisk the eggs in a bowl with salt and pepper. 2. Heat oil in a skillet, add chopped onions, and bell peppers, and sauté until soft. 3. Add spinach and cook until wilted. 4. Pour the eggs over the veggies and cook until set. 5. Fold the omelette in half and serve hot.

name: Banana Pancakes with Oats
description: Fluffy and wholesome pancakes made with oats and bananas, perfect for a delightful breakfast treat.
ingredients: oats, ripe bananas, eggs, milk, baking powder, cinnamon
instructions: 1. In a bowl, mash the ripe bananas. 2. Add eggs, milk, oats, baking powder, and cinnamon. 3. Mix until combined. 4. Heat a skillet and pour batter to form pancakes. 5. Cook until bubbles form, then flip and cook until golden brown. 6. Serve with syrup or fresh fruit.

name: Whole Grain Toast with Nut Butter and Banana
description: A simple yet satisfying breakfast with nut butter spread on whole grain toast topped with banana slices.
ingredients: whole grain bread, almond butter, banana, honey
instructions: 1. Toast the whole grain bread until golden. 2. Spread almond butter generously over the toast. 3. Slice bananas and arrange them on top of the nut butter. 4. Drizzle with honey if desired. 5. Serve immediately.

name: Cottage Cheese with Pineapple and Walnuts
description: A refreshing and protein-packed breakfast made with cottage cheese topped with sweet pineapple and crunchy walnuts.
ingredients: cottage cheese, pineapple chunks, walnuts, honey
instructions: 1. In a bowl, add cottage cheese. 2. Top with pineapple chunks and chopped walnuts. 3. Drizzle with honey for added sweetness. 4. Mix lightly and enjoy this protein-rich breakfast.

name: Chia Seed Pudding with Coconut Milk
description: A creamy and satisfying pudding made with chia seeds and coconut milk, perfect for breakfast or a healthy snack.
ingredients: chia seeds, coconut milk, honey, vanilla extract, fresh fruits
instructions: 1. In a bowl, mix chia seeds, coconut milk, honey, and vanilla extract. 2. Stir well and let sit for 10 minutes. 3. Stir again to prevent clumping and refrigerate for at least 2 hours or overnight. 4. Serve chilled, topped with fresh fruits.

name: Rawa Pongal (Savory Rice and Lentil Dish)
description: A comforting and delicious dish made with semolina and lentils, spiced with black pepper and ginger, typically served with coconut chutney.
ingredients: semolina, yellow moong dal, ginger, black pepper, curry leaves, ghee, salt, water
instructions: 1. Dry roast semolina until lightly golden and set aside. 2. In a pot, boil water and add yellow moong dal. 3. Cook until soft, then add roasted semolina, ginger, black pepper, and salt. 4. Stir well and cook until the mixture thickens. 5. Heat ghee in a separate pan, add curry leaves, and pour over the Pongal. 6. Serve hot with coconut chutney.

name: Vegetable Uttapam (Thick Pancake with Vegetables)
description: A thick and hearty pancake topped with assorted vegetables, perfect for a wholesome breakfast.
ingredients: rice flour, urad dal, onions, tomatoes, bell peppers, green chilies, coriander leaves, salt, oil
instructions: 1. Soak rice and urad dal for 6-8 hours, then grind to a smooth batter. 2. Add salt and let it ferment overnight. 3. Heat a skillet, pour batter to form a thick pancake, and top with chopped vegetables. 4. Cook until the bottom is golden, then flip and cook the other side. 5. Serve hot with sambar and chutney.

name: Moong Dal Chilla (Lentil Pancakes)
description: Healthy and protein-rich pancakes made from ground moong dal, perfect for breakfast or snacks.
ingredients: moong dal, green chilies, ginger, onions, coriander leaves, salt, oil
instructions: 1. Soak moong dal for 4-5 hours, then grind to a smooth batter with green chilies and ginger. 2. Mix in chopped onions, coriander leaves, and salt. 3. Heat oil in a skillet, pour a ladle of batter to form pancakes. 4. Cook until both sides are golden brown. 5. Serve hot with green chutney.

name: Besan Cheela (Gram Flour Pancakes)
description: Savory pancakes made with gram flour and spices, a nutritious breakfast option rich in protein.
ingredients: besan (gram flour), onions, tomatoes, green chilies, spices, coriander leaves, water, salt, oil
instructions: 1. In a bowl, mix besan, chopped onions, tomatoes, green chilies, coriander leaves, spices, and salt. 2. Add water to form a smooth batter. 3. Heat oil in a skillet, pour batter to make pancakes. 4. Cook until both sides are golden brown. 5. Serve with yogurt or chutney.

name: Oats Porridge with Fruits
description: A nutritious and filling porridge made with oats and topped with a variety of fresh fruits, perfect for a healthy breakfast.
ingredients: rolled oats, milk or water, honey, mixed fruits, nuts, chia seeds
instructions: 1. In a pot, combine rolled oats and milk (or water) and bring to a boil. 2. Reduce heat and simmer until oats are cooked. 3. Sweeten with honey and stir in chia seeds. 4. Top with mixed fruits and nuts. 5. Serve warm.

name: Vegetable Khichdi (Rice and Lentil Mix with Vegetables)
description: A comforting one-pot dish made with rice, lentils, and assorted vegetables, spiced mildly for a healthy meal.
ingredients: rice, yellow moong dal, mixed vegetables (carrots, peas, beans), ginger, cumin seeds, turmeric, salt, ghee
instructions: 1. Rinse rice and dal thoroughly. 2. In a pot, heat ghee and add cumin seeds and ginger. 3. Add mixed vegetables, turmeric, and salt, and sauté. 4. Add rice and dal, followed by water, and bring to a boil. 5. Cook until the rice and dal are soft. 6. Serve hot with pickle or yogurt.

name: Sabudana Khichdi (Tapioca Pearl Dish)
description: A popular fasting dish made with tapioca pearls, potatoes, and peanuts, lightly spiced for flavor.
ingredients: sabudana (tapioca pearls), potatoes, peanuts, green chilies, cumin seeds, salt, ghee
instructions: 1. Soak sabudana in water for 2-3 hours, drain excess water. 2. Boil and mash potatoes. 3. In a pan, heat ghee and add cumin seeds and chopped green chilies. 4. Add sabudana, potatoes, and roasted peanuts, and mix well. 5. Cook for a few minutes until sabudana becomes translucent. 6. Serve hot with yogurt.

name: Dhokla (Steamed Chickpea Flour Snack)
description: A fluffy and savory steamed cake made from chickpea flour, perfect for breakfast or snacks.
ingredients: besan (chickpea flour), yogurt, ginger paste, green chilies, turmeric, mustard seeds, curry leaves, salt
instructions: 1. In a bowl, mix besan, yogurt, ginger paste, green chilies, turmeric, and salt to form a batter. 2. Add water to achieve pouring consistency. 3. Pour the batter into a greased steaming dish and steam for 15-20 minutes. 4. In a pan, heat oil and add mustard seeds and curry leaves for tempering. 5. Pour the tempering over the steamed dhokla. 6. Cut into squares and serve with green chutney.

name: Sprouted Moong Salad
description: A refreshing salad made with sprouted green moong, veggies, and a tangy dressing, packed with nutrients.
ingredients: sprouted moong, cucumber, tomatoes, onions, lemon juice, salt, chaat masala
instructions: 1. In a bowl, combine sprouted moong, chopped cucumber, tomatoes, and onions. 2. Drizzle with lemon juice, and sprinkle salt and chaat masala. 3. Toss well to mix. 4. Serve fresh for a healthy snack or breakfast.

name: Ragi Mudde (Finger Millet Balls)
description: A traditional South Indian dish made from finger millet flour, typically served with sambar or curry.
ingredients: ragi flour, water, salt
instructions: 1. In a pot, boil water with a pinch of salt. 2. Gradually add ragi flour, stirring continuously to avoid lumps. 3. Cook on low heat until the mixture thickens and starts to pull away from the sides. 4. Once cooked, shape the mixture into balls using wet hands. 5. Serve with sambar or any curry of your choice.

name: Quinoa Salad with Chickpeas and Vegetables
description: A refreshing and nutritious salad made with quinoa, chickpeas, and a variety of colorful vegetables, drizzled with a lemon vinaigrette.
ingredients: quinoa, chickpeas, cucumber, bell peppers, cherry tomatoes, parsley, olive oil, lemon juice, salt, pepper
instructions: 1. Rinse quinoa under cold water and cook according to package instructions. 2. In a large bowl, combine cooked quinoa, chickpeas, diced cucumber, bell peppers, cherry tomatoes, and chopped parsley. 3. In a small bowl, whisk together olive oil, lemon juice, salt, and pepper. 4. Pour the dressing over the salad and toss well to combine. 5. Serve chilled or at room temperature.

name: Grilled Chicken Salad with Avocado
description: A hearty salad featuring grilled chicken breast, fresh greens, and creamy avocado, topped with a tangy dressing.
ingredients: grilled chicken breast, mixed greens, avocado, cherry tomatoes, cucumber, olive oil, balsamic vinegar, salt, pepper
instructions: 1. Season chicken breast with salt and pepper, and grill until cooked through. 2. In a large bowl, combine mixed greens, sliced avocado, halved cherry tomatoes, and sliced cucumber. 3. Slice the grilled chicken and add it to the salad. 4. In a small bowl, whisk together olive oil, balsamic vinegar, salt, and pepper. 5. Drizzle the dressing over the salad and toss gently. 6. Serve immediately.

name: Lentil Soup with Spinach and Carrots
description: A hearty and nutritious soup made with lentils, fresh spinach, and carrots, flavored with herbs and spices.
ingredients: green lentils, spinach, carrots, onions, garlic, vegetable broth, cumin, salt, pepper, olive oil
instructions: 1. In a large pot, heat olive oil over medium heat and sauté chopped onions and garlic until translucent. 2. Add diced carrots and cook for a few minutes. 3. Add lentils, vegetable broth, cumin, salt, and pepper, and bring to a boil. 4. Reduce heat and simmer until lentils are tender. 5. Stir in fresh spinach and cook until wilted. 6. Serve hot with crusty bread.

name: Brown Rice Bowl with Steamed Broccoli and Tofu
description: A wholesome bowl of brown rice topped with steamed broccoli and marinated tofu, drizzled with a sesame dressing.
ingredients: brown rice, tofu, broccoli, soy sauce, sesame oil, garlic, ginger, sesame seeds
instructions: 1. Cook brown rice according to package instructions. 2. Press and cube tofu, then marinate in soy sauce, sesame oil, minced garlic, and ginger for 15 minutes. 3. Steam broccoli until tender. 4. In a skillet, cook marinated tofu until golden. 5. In a bowl, layer brown rice, steamed broccoli, and tofu. 6. Sprinkle with sesame seeds and serve.

name: Chickpea and Spinach Curry
description: A flavorful curry made with chickpeas and spinach, simmered in spices and coconut milk, served with rice or bread.
ingredients: chickpeas, spinach, coconut milk, onion, garlic, ginger, curry powder, cumin, salt, olive oil
instructions: 1. In a pot, heat olive oil and sauté chopped onion, garlic, and ginger until golden. 2. Add curry powder and cumin, and cook for another minute. 3. Stir in chickpeas and coconut milk, and bring to a simmer. 4. Add spinach and cook until wilted. 5. Season with salt and serve with rice or bread.

name: Vegetable Stir-Fry with Brown Rice
description: A quick and colorful stir-fry of assorted vegetables served over brown rice, perfect for a healthy meal.
ingredients: mixed vegetables (bell peppers, broccoli, carrots), brown rice, soy sauce, garlic, ginger, sesame oil
instructions: 1. Cook brown rice according to package instructions. 2. In a wok, heat sesame oil and sauté minced garlic and ginger. 3. Add mixed vegetables and stir-fry until tender-crisp. 4. Add cooked brown rice and soy sauce, and stir until combined. 5. Serve hot, garnished with sesame seeds.

name: Zucchini Noodles with Pesto and Cherry Tomatoes
description: A light and healthy dish featuring spiralized zucchini tossed in pesto and topped with fresh cherry tomatoes.
ingredients: zucchini, cherry tomatoes, pesto, olive oil, salt, pepper
instructions: 1. Spiralize zucchini into noodles. 2. In a skillet, heat olive oil and add zucchini noodles, sautéing for 2-3 minutes until slightly tender. 3. Stir in pesto and halved cherry tomatoes. 4. Cook for another minute until heated through. 5. Season with salt and pepper, and serve immediately.

name: Whole Wheat Wrap with Hummus and Veggies
description: A healthy and satisfying wrap filled with hummus, fresh veggies, and herbs, great for lunch on-the-go.
ingredients: whole wheat wrap, hummus, lettuce, cucumber, bell peppers, carrots, parsley, lemon juice, salt
instructions: 1. Spread a generous layer of hummus over the whole wheat wrap. 2. Layer with lettuce, sliced cucumber, bell peppers, grated carrots, and chopped parsley. 3. Drizzle with lemon juice and sprinkle with salt. 4. Roll the wrap tightly and cut in half. 5. Serve as a quick and healthy lunch.

name: Baked Salmon with Asparagus
description: A simple yet elegant dish featuring baked salmon and tender asparagus, seasoned with herbs and lemon.
ingredients: salmon fillet, asparagus, olive oil, lemon, garlic, salt, pepper
instructions: 1. Preheat the oven to 400°F (200°C). 2. Place salmon fillet and asparagus on a baking sheet. 3. Drizzle with olive oil, lemon juice, minced garlic, salt, and pepper. 4. Bake for 15-20 minutes until salmon is cooked through. 5. Serve hot with a wedge of lemon.

name: Greek Quinoa Bowl with Feta and Olives
description: A vibrant and protein-packed bowl with quinoa, feta cheese, olives, and fresh vegetables, drizzled with olive oil.
ingredients: quinoa, feta cheese, olives, cucumber, tomatoes, red onion, olive oil, lemon juice, salt, pepper
instructions: 1. Cook quinoa according to package instructions and let cool. 2. In a large bowl, combine cooked quinoa, diced cucumber, tomatoes, red onion, crumbled feta, and olives. 3. Drizzle with olive oil and lemon juice, and season with salt and pepper. 4. Toss well and serve chilled or at room temperature.

name: Cauliflower Rice Stir-Fry
description: A low-carb alternative to fried rice made with cauliflower rice, mixed vegetables, and soy sauce, quick and easy to prepare.
ingredients: cauliflower, mixed vegetables (peas, carrots, bell peppers), soy sauce, garlic, ginger, sesame oil, green onions
instructions: 1. Grate cauliflower to make cauliflower rice. 2. In a skillet, heat sesame oil and sauté minced garlic and ginger. 3. Add mixed vegetables and stir-fry for a few minutes. 4. Add cauliflower rice and soy sauce, cooking until heated through. 5. Garnish with chopped green onions and serve.

name: Black Bean and Corn Salad
description: A hearty salad made with black beans, corn, and fresh veggies, dressed with lime and cilantro for flavor.
ingredients: black beans, corn, bell peppers, red onion, cilantro, lime juice, olive oil, salt
instructions: 1. In a bowl, combine black beans, corn, diced bell peppers, and chopped red onion. 2. In a separate bowl, whisk together lime juice, olive oil, and salt. 3. Pour the dressing over the salad and mix well. 4. Garnish with chopped cilantro and serve chilled.

name: Stuffed Bell Peppers with Quinoa and Veggies
description: Colorful bell peppers filled with a delicious mixture of quinoa, vegetables, and spices, baked until tender.
ingredients: bell peppers, quinoa, black beans, corn, onion, garlic, cumin, salt, pepper, cheese
instructions: 1. Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C). 2. Cook quinoa according to package instructions. 3. In a skillet, sauté chopped onion and garlic, then add black beans, corn, and cooked quinoa. 4. Season with cumin, salt, and pepper. 5. Cut the tops off bell peppers and remove seeds. 6. Fill peppers with quinoa mixture and place in a baking dish. 7. Cover with foil and bake for 30 minutes. 8. Serve warm.

name: Roasted Sweet Potato and Black Bean Tacos
description: A delicious taco filling made with roasted sweet potatoes and black beans, topped with avocado and salsa.
ingredients: sweet potatoes, black beans, corn tortillas, avocado, salsa, lime juice, cumin, salt
instructions: 1. Preheat the oven to 400°F (200°C). 2. Peel and cube sweet potatoes, toss with olive oil, cumin, and salt, and roast until tender (about 25 minutes). 3. Warm corn tortillas in a skillet. 4. Fill tortillas with roasted sweet potatoes, black beans, and top with avocado and salsa. 5. Drizzle with lime juice and serve.

name: Thai Peanut Noodle Salad with Veggies
description: A refreshing salad of rice noodles tossed with crunchy veggies and a creamy peanut sauce, perfect for warm days.
ingredients: rice noodles, bell peppers, carrots, cucumbers, peanut butter, soy sauce, lime juice, sesame oil, cilantro
instructions: 1. Cook rice noodles according to package instructions and drain. 2. In a bowl, whisk together peanut butter, soy sauce, lime juice, and sesame oil. 3. In a large bowl, combine cooked noodles, sliced bell peppers, shredded carrots, and cucumbers. 4. Pour the peanut sauce over the salad and toss to combine. 5. Garnish with chopped cilantro and serve chilled.

name: Vegetable Biryani
description: A fragrant and flavorful rice dish made with a variety of vegetables, spices, and basmati rice, often garnished with fried onions.
ingredients: basmati rice, mixed vegetables (carrots, peas, beans), onion, ginger, garlic, biryani masala, saffron, ghee, salt
instructions: 1. Soak basmati rice for 30 minutes and drain. 2. In a pot, heat ghee and sauté sliced onions until golden. 3. Add ginger and garlic, followed by mixed vegetables and biryani masala. 4. Add soaked rice, water, saffron, and salt. 5. Cover and cook until rice is tender. 6. Garnish with fried onions and serve with raita.

name: Chana Masala
description: A hearty and spiced chickpea curry cooked with onions, tomatoes, and a blend of spices, served with rice or bread.
ingredients: chickpeas, onion, tomato, ginger, garlic, chana masala spice, cumin, coriander, salt, oil
instructions: 1. Soak chickpeas overnight and cook until tender. 2. Heat oil in a pan and sauté chopped onions until golden. 3. Add minced ginger and garlic, followed by chopped tomatoes and spices. 4. Stir in cooked chickpeas and simmer for 10 minutes. 5. Serve hot with rice or bread.

name: Rajma
description: A popular North Indian dish made with kidney beans in a spiced tomato gravy, best served with rice.
ingredients: kidney beans, onion, tomato, ginger, garlic, rajma masala, cumin, salt, oil
instructions: 1. Soak kidney beans overnight and cook until soft. 2. In a pan, heat oil and sauté chopped onions until golden. 3. Add minced ginger and garlic, then add chopped tomatoes and rajma masala. 4. Mix in cooked beans and simmer for 15 minutes. 5. Serve with steamed rice.

name: Palak Paneer
description: A creamy and flavorful curry made with spinach and paneer (Indian cottage cheese), seasoned with spices.
ingredients: spinach, paneer, onion, ginger, garlic, green chili, garam masala, cream, salt, oil
instructions: 1. Blanch spinach in hot water and blend to a puree. 2. Heat oil in a pan, sauté chopped onions, ginger, and garlic. 3. Add spinach puree, garam masala, and cream. 4. Stir in cubed paneer and simmer for 10 minutes. 5. Serve with roti or naan.

name: Masoor Dal
description: A nutritious red lentil curry cooked with spices and herbs, often served with rice or bread.
ingredients: red lentils, onion, tomato, ginger, garlic, turmeric, cumin, salt, oil
instructions: 1. Rinse lentils and cook with water, turmeric, and salt until soft. 2. In a pan, heat oil and sauté chopped onions, ginger, and garlic. 3. Add chopped tomatoes and cook until soft. 4. Mix in cooked lentils and simmer for 10 minutes. 5. Serve hot with rice or bread.

name: Baingan Bharta
description: A smoky and spiced eggplant dish roasted and mashed with tomatoes and spices, typically served with roti.
ingredients: eggplant, tomato, onion, ginger, garlic, cumin, coriander, salt, oil
instructions: 1. Roast eggplant until charred, peel, and mash. 2. Heat oil in a pan and sauté chopped onions, ginger, and garlic. 3. Add chopped tomatoes and spices, cooking until soft. 4. Stir in mashed eggplant and cook for 5 minutes. 5. Serve with roti or naan.

name: Mixed Vegetable Curry
description: A colorful curry made with seasonal vegetables, cooked in a spicy gravy, served with rice or bread.
ingredients: mixed vegetables (carrots, peas, beans, potatoes), onion, tomato, ginger, garlic, curry powder, salt, oil
instructions: 1. Heat oil in a pan and sauté chopped onions, ginger, and garlic. 2. Add chopped tomatoes and curry powder, cooking until soft. 3. Stir in mixed vegetables and add water to cover. 4. Cook until vegetables are tender. 5. Serve hot with rice or bread.

name: Kadhi Pakora
description: A tangy yogurt-based curry with deep-fried gram flour dumplings, often enjoyed with rice.
ingredients: yogurt, gram flour, onion, spices, curry leaves, salt, oil
instructions: 1. Mix gram flour with spices, water, and make a batter. 2. Deep-fry small dumplings until golden. 3. In a pot, whisk yogurt and add water, then heat gently. 4. Add curry leaves, spices, and the fried dumplings. 5. Serve with rice.

name: Paneer Tikka
description: Marinated paneer cubes grilled or baked, served with mint chutney and salad as a starter or snack.
ingredients: paneer, yogurt, spices (tikka masala), bell peppers, onion, lemon juice, salt
instructions: 1. Marinate paneer cubes in yogurt and spices for 1 hour. 2. Thread paneer, bell peppers, and onion onto skewers. 3. Grill or bake until charred. 4. Serve hot with mint chutney.

name: Khichdi
description: A comforting one-pot dish made with rice and lentils, often flavored with spices, great for digestion.
ingredients: rice, lentils (moong dal), turmeric, salt, ghee, cumin, vegetables (optional)
instructions: 1. Rinse rice and lentils, then cook with water, turmeric, and salt until soft. 2. In a separate pan, heat ghee and cumin, adding any vegetables. 3. Mix in cooked rice and lentils. 4. Serve hot with pickle or yogurt.

name: Oats Khichdi
description: A healthy twist on traditional khichdi using oats instead of rice, mixed with lentils and spices.
ingredients: oats, lentils (moong dal), turmeric, salt, ghee, cumin, vegetables (optional)
instructions: 1. Rinse lentils and cook with oats, water, turmeric, and salt until soft. 2. In a pan, heat ghee and cumin, adding any vegetables. 3. Stir in cooked mixture and cook for another 5 minutes. 4. Serve hot with pickle or yogurt.

name: Vegetable Pulao
description: A fragrant rice dish made with basmati rice, mixed vegetables, and spices, often served with raita.
ingredients: basmati rice, mixed vegetables (carrots, peas), onion, cumin, bay leaf, ghee, salt
instructions: 1. Rinse basmati rice and soak for 30 minutes. 2. Heat ghee in a pot, add cumin and bay leaf. 3. Sauté chopped onions until golden. 4. Add mixed vegetables and soaked rice, along with water and salt. 5. Cover and cook until rice is tender. 6. Serve with raita.

name: Daal Fry
description: A flavorful preparation of cooked lentils tempered with spices, often served with rice or bread.
ingredients: lentils (toor dal), onion, tomato, garlic, cumin, mustard seeds, salt, oil
instructions: 1. Cook lentils until soft and mash slightly. 2. In a pan, heat oil and add mustard seeds and cumin. 3. Add chopped onions and garlic, sauté until golden. 4. Stir in chopped tomatoes and cook until soft. 5. Mix in cooked lentils, add salt, and simmer for 5 minutes. 6. Serve hot with rice or bread.

name: Methi Malai Murg
description: A rich and creamy chicken dish cooked with fenugreek leaves and spices, served with naan or rice.
ingredients: chicken, methi (fenugreek leaves), cream, onion, ginger, garlic, spices, salt
instructions: 1. Marinate chicken with spices and salt. 2. In a pan, heat oil and sauté chopped onions, ginger, and garlic. 3. Add marinated chicken and cook until done. 4. Stir in cream and fenugreek leaves, simmer for 10 minutes. 5. Serve with naan or rice.

name: Cabbage Sabzi
description: A simple stir-fried cabbage dish seasoned with spices, often served as a side.
ingredients: cabbage, onion, cumin, turmeric, green chili, salt, oil
instructions: 1. Heat oil in a pan and add cumin seeds. 2. Add chopped onions and sauté until translucent. 3. Stir in chopped cabbage, turmeric, green chili, and salt. 4. Cook until cabbage is tender. 5. Serve warm as a side dish.

name: Grilled Lemon Herb Chicken with Quinoa
description: Juicy chicken marinated in lemon and herbs, served with fluffy quinoa and steamed vegetables for a wholesome meal.
ingredients: chicken breast, lemon juice, garlic, olive oil, herbs (thyme, rosemary), quinoa, mixed vegetables (broccoli, carrots)
instructions: 1. Marinate chicken in lemon juice, garlic, olive oil, and herbs for at least 30 minutes. 2. Grill chicken for 6-7 minutes on each side until cooked through. 3. Cook quinoa according to package instructions. 4. Steam mixed vegetables. 5. Serve grilled chicken over quinoa with vegetables on the side.

name: Baked Cod with Vegetables
description: Tender cod fillets baked with a medley of colorful vegetables, drizzled with olive oil and herbs for flavor.
ingredients: cod fillets, zucchini, bell pepper, cherry tomatoes, olive oil, garlic, salt, pepper
instructions: 1. Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C). 2. Arrange cod and chopped vegetables on a baking sheet. 3. Drizzle with olive oil, minced garlic, salt, and pepper. 4. Bake for 15-20 minutes until cod is flaky and vegetables are tender. 5. Serve hot.

name: Zucchini Noodles with Marinara Sauce
description: A light and healthy alternative to pasta, zucchini noodles topped with a rich marinara sauce, perfect for a low-carb meal.
ingredients: zucchini, marinara sauce, olive oil, garlic, salt, pepper, basil
instructions: 1. Spiralize zucchini into noodles. 2. In a pan, heat olive oil and sauté minced garlic until fragrant. 3. Add marinara sauce and simmer for 5 minutes. 4. Toss in zucchini noodles and cook for 2-3 minutes until tender. 5. Serve garnished with fresh basil.

name: Stuffed Bell Peppers with Brown Rice and Turkey
description: Bell peppers filled with a savory mixture of brown rice, ground turkey, and spices, baked to perfection.
ingredients: bell peppers, ground turkey, brown rice, onion, garlic, diced tomatoes, spices (cumin, paprika), cheese (optional)
instructions: 1. Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C). 2. Cook brown rice according to package instructions. 3. In a skillet, sauté onions and garlic, then add ground turkey and cook until browned. 4. Stir in cooked rice and diced tomatoes. 5. Cut tops off bell peppers and remove seeds, then stuff with the turkey mixture. 6. Place in a baking dish and bake for 30 minutes. 7. Optionally, sprinkle cheese on top before serving.

name: Vegetable Stir-Fry with Tofu
description: A quick and colorful stir-fry featuring tofu and a variety of fresh vegetables, tossed in a savory sauce.
ingredients: tofu, mixed vegetables (broccoli, bell pepper, snap peas), soy sauce, garlic, ginger, sesame oil
instructions: 1. Press tofu to remove excess moisture and cut into cubes. 2. In a pan, heat sesame oil and sauté garlic and ginger. 3. Add mixed vegetables and cook for 5 minutes. 4. Add tofu and soy sauce, cooking until heated through. 5. Serve hot over rice or noodles.

name: Chickpea and Spinach Stew
description: A hearty stew made with chickpeas and spinach, flavored with spices, perfect for a comforting meal.
ingredients: chickpeas, spinach, onion, garlic, ginger, diced tomatoes, cumin, coriander, salt
instructions: 1. In a pot, heat oil and sauté chopped onions, garlic, and ginger until soft. 2. Add diced tomatoes and cook for 5 minutes. 3. Stir in chickpeas, spinach, and spices, simmer for 15 minutes. 4. Serve warm with bread or rice.

name: Lentil Tacos with Avocado
description: Healthy and delicious tacos filled with spiced lentils, topped with fresh avocado and salsa.
ingredients: lentils, taco seasoning, tortillas, avocado, salsa, lettuce
instructions: 1. Cook lentils according to package instructions. 2. Add taco seasoning to lentils and simmer for 5 minutes. 3. Warm tortillas and fill with lentils, avocado, and salsa. 4. Serve with lettuce on the side.

name: Baked Sweet Potatoes with Black Beans
description: Nutritious sweet potatoes stuffed with seasoned black beans and topped with cheese or avocado for a satisfying dish.
ingredients: sweet potatoes, black beans, cumin, garlic, cheese (optional), avocado
instructions: 1. Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C). 2. Pierce sweet potatoes with a fork and bake for 45-60 minutes until tender. 3. In a bowl, mix black beans with cumin and minced garlic. 4. Once sweet potatoes are cooked, cut them open and fill with black bean mixture. 5. Top with cheese or avocado, if desired.

name: Quinoa and Black Bean Salad
description: A refreshing salad packed with protein-rich quinoa and black beans, tossed with lime dressing and vegetables.
ingredients: quinoa, black beans, corn, bell pepper, cilantro, lime juice, olive oil, salt
instructions: 1. Cook quinoa according to package instructions and let cool. 2. In a bowl, combine cooked quinoa, black beans, corn, diced bell pepper, and chopped cilantro. 3. Whisk lime juice, olive oil, and salt, then pour over the salad. 4. Toss to combine and serve chilled.

name: Miso Soup with Tofu and Seaweed
description: A traditional Japanese soup made with miso paste, tofu, and seaweed, light yet flavorful.
ingredients: miso paste, tofu, seaweed, green onions, water
instructions: 1. In a pot, bring water to a boil. 2. Add miso paste and stir until dissolved. 3. Add cubed tofu and seaweed, simmer for 5 minutes. 4. Garnish with chopped green onions and serve hot.

name: Grilled Salmon with Asparagus
description: Delicious salmon fillets grilled and served with roasted asparagus for a healthy and balanced meal.
ingredients: salmon fillets, asparagus, olive oil, lemon juice, garlic, salt, pepper
instructions: 1. Preheat grill to medium-high heat. 2. Season salmon and asparagus with olive oil, lemon juice, garlic, salt, and pepper. 3. Grill salmon for 4-5 minutes per side and asparagus for 5-7 minutes until tender. 4. Serve immediately.

name: Spaghetti Squash with Pesto and Cherry Tomatoes
description: A low-carb alternative to pasta, spaghetti squash topped with homemade pesto and fresh cherry tomatoes.
ingredients: spaghetti squash, pesto, cherry tomatoes, olive oil, salt, pepper
instructions: 1. Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C). 2. Cut spaghetti squash in half and remove seeds. 3. Drizzle with olive oil, salt, and pepper, and bake for 30-40 minutes until tender. 4. Scrape squash with a fork to create strands and mix with pesto and halved cherry tomatoes. 5. Serve warm.

name: Coconut Curry Lentils with Spinach
description: Creamy and flavorful lentils cooked in coconut milk with spinach, spices, and served over rice.
ingredients: lentils, coconut milk, spinach, onion, garlic, ginger, curry powder, salt
instructions: 1. In a pot, heat oil and sauté chopped onions, garlic, and ginger until soft. 2. Add lentils, coconut milk, spinach, and curry powder, and simmer for 20 minutes. 3. Serve hot over rice.

name: Cauliflower Fried Rice
description: A low-carb and healthy version of fried rice made with grated cauliflower and a mix of vegetables.
ingredients: cauliflower, mixed vegetables (carrots, peas), soy sauce, garlic, green onion, eggs (optional)
instructions: 1. Grate cauliflower into rice-sized pieces. 2. In a pan, heat oil and sauté garlic, then add mixed vegetables. 3. Stir in cauliflower and soy sauce, cooking for 5-7 minutes. 4. Optionally, scramble in eggs and serve hot.

name: Chicken Fajitas with Bell Peppers and Onions
description: Sizzling chicken fajitas cooked with bell peppers and onions, served with tortillas and toppings.
ingredients: chicken breast, bell peppers, onions, fajita seasoning, tortillas, avocado, salsa
instructions: 1. In a skillet, cook sliced chicken with fajita seasoning until browned. 2. Add sliced bell peppers and onions, cooking until tender. 3. Warm tortillas and fill with chicken mixture. 4. Serve with avocado and salsa on top.

name: Tandoori Chicken
description: Spicy and flavorful marinated chicken grilled to perfection, served with mint chutney.
ingredients: chicken pieces, yogurt, lemon juice, garlic, ginger, tandoori masala, salt, oil
instructions: 1. In a bowl, mix yogurt, lemon juice, minced garlic, ginger, tandoori masala, and salt. 2. Marinate chicken in this mixture for at least 2 hours or overnight. 3. Preheat the grill to medium-high heat. 4. Grill the marinated chicken for 20-30 minutes, turning occasionally, until fully cooked. 5. Serve hot with mint chutney.

name: Vegetable Korma
description: A creamy and rich curry made with assorted vegetables and aromatic spices, perfect with rice or bread.
ingredients: mixed vegetables (carrots, peas, beans, potatoes), onion, tomato, coconut milk, korma masala, ginger-garlic paste, salt
instructions: 1. In a pan, heat oil and sauté chopped onions until golden. 2. Add ginger-garlic paste and cook for a minute. 3. Add chopped tomatoes and korma masala, cooking until tomatoes are soft. 4. Stir in mixed vegetables and coconut milk, simmering until the vegetables are tender. 5. Serve hot with rice or naan.

name: Chicken Tikka Masala
description: Tender pieces of chicken in a creamy, spiced tomato sauce, served with naan or rice for a hearty meal.
ingredients: chicken breast, yogurt, tomato puree, cream, onion, garlic, ginger, garam masala, salt
instructions: 1. Marinate chicken in yogurt, garlic, and ginger for at least 1 hour. 2. Grill or bake chicken until cooked, then set aside. 3. In a pan, heat oil and sauté onions until golden. 4. Add garlic, ginger, and garam masala, cooking for a minute. 5. Add tomato puree and simmer for 10 minutes. 6. Stir in cream and add grilled chicken, simmering for an additional 5 minutes. 7. Serve with naan or rice.

name: Dal Tadka
description: A comforting and nutritious lentil dish tempered with spices, best enjoyed with rice or roti.
ingredients: yellow lentils (toor dal), onion, tomato, cumin seeds, garlic, turmeric powder, salt, coriander leaves
instructions: 1. Cook lentils in water until soft. 2. In a pan, heat oil and add cumin seeds, letting them splutter. 3. Add chopped onions and sauté until golden. 4. Stir in garlic, turmeric, and chopped tomatoes, cooking until tomatoes soften. 5. Mix this tempering into the cooked lentils, adding salt to taste. 6. Garnish with chopped coriander leaves and serve hot.

name: Paneer Butter Masala
description: Soft paneer cubes in a rich, creamy tomato sauce with a hint of butter, served with naan or rice.
ingredients: paneer, tomato puree, cream, butter, onion, garlic, ginger, garam masala, kasuri methi, salt
instructions: 1. Heat butter in a pan and sauté chopped onions until golden. 2. Add garlic and ginger, cooking for a minute. 3. Stir in tomato puree and garam masala, simmering for 10 minutes. 4. Add cream and paneer cubes, cooking for an additional 5 minutes. 5. Add kasuri methi and serve with naan or rice.

name: Bhindi Masala
description: Stir-fried okra with spices, making a flavorful side dish for any Indian meal.
ingredients: okra, onion, tomato, cumin seeds, turmeric powder, coriander powder, salt, oil
instructions: 1. Wash and cut okra into pieces. 2. In a pan, heat oil and add cumin seeds. 3. Add chopped onions and sauté until golden. 4. Add okra and sauté until cooked. 5. Stir in chopped tomatoes, turmeric, coriander powder, and salt. 6. Cook until the tomatoes soften and serve hot.

name: Saag Paneer
description: A classic Indian dish made with spinach and paneer in a spiced sauce, perfect with roti.
ingredients: spinach, paneer, onion, garlic, ginger, green chilies, garam masala, salt
instructions: 1. Boil spinach and blend it into a smooth paste. 2. In a pan, heat oil and sauté onions until golden. 3. Add garlic, ginger, and green chilies, cooking for a minute. 4. Stir in the spinach paste and garam masala, simmering for 5 minutes. 5. Add paneer cubes and cook for another 5 minutes. 6. Serve hot with roti.

name: Chole
description: Spicy and hearty chickpea curry, a staple in North Indian cuisine, best served with rice or bhature.
ingredients: chickpeas, onion, tomato, garlic, ginger, chole masala, salt, oil
instructions: 1. Soak chickpeas overnight and cook until tender. 2. In a pan, heat oil and sauté chopped onions until golden. 3. Add garlic, ginger, and tomatoes, cooking until soft. 4. Stir in chole masala and cooked chickpeas, simmering for 20 minutes. 5. Serve hot with rice or bhature.

name: Vegetable Pulao
description: A fragrant rice dish cooked with assorted vegetables and spices, perfect as a main course.
ingredients: rice, mixed vegetables (peas, carrots, beans), cumin seeds, bay leaf, garam masala, salt, oil
instructions: 1. Wash and soak rice for 30 minutes. 2. In a pan, heat oil and add cumin seeds and bay leaf. 3. Add chopped vegetables and sauté for a few minutes. 4. Add soaked rice, garam masala, and water, cooking until rice is done. 5. Serve hot with raita.

name: Lentil and Spinach Curry
description: A wholesome curry made with lentils and spinach, flavored with spices, best with rice or roti.
ingredients: lentils, spinach, onion, garlic, ginger, turmeric, cumin, salt
instructions: 1. Cook lentils in water until soft. 2. In a pan, heat oil and sauté onions, garlic, and ginger. 3. Add turmeric and cumin, then stir in cooked lentils and spinach. 4. Simmer for 10 minutes and serve hot.

name: Masala Roti with Raita
description: Whole wheat flatbreads infused with spices, served with refreshing yogurt raita.
ingredients: whole wheat flour, spices (cumin, coriander), water, yogurt, cucumber, mint
instructions: 1. In a bowl, mix whole wheat flour with spices and water to form a dough. 2. Roll out into flatbreads and cook on a hot griddle until golden. 3. For raita, mix yogurt with chopped cucumber and mint. 4. Serve roti hot with raita.

name: Kadhi with Brown Rice
description: A tangy yogurt-based curry with gram flour dumplings, served over brown rice for a nutritious meal.
ingredients: yogurt, gram flour, spices (turmeric, cumin), salt, brown rice
instructions: 1. In a bowl, mix yogurt and gram flour with water, spices, and salt to form a batter. 2. Steam or fry small dumplings from the batter. 3. In a pot, heat yogurt with spices, adding water to make a curry. 4. Add dumplings and simmer. 5. Serve over cooked brown rice.

name: Stuffed Parathas
description: Whole wheat flatbreads stuffed with spiced potatoes or paneer, served with yogurt or pickle.
ingredients: whole wheat flour, potatoes/paneer, spices (cumin, coriander), yogurt, oil
instructions: 1. In a bowl, knead whole wheat flour into a soft dough. 2. Boil and mash potatoes or crumble paneer, mixing with spices. 3. Roll out dough, fill with the mixture, and seal. 4. Cook on a griddle until golden on both sides. 5. Serve hot with yogurt or pickle.

name: Cabbage and Peas Sabzi
description: A simple and quick stir-fry of cabbage and peas, seasoned with spices, great as a side dish.
ingredients: cabbage, green peas, cumin seeds, turmeric, salt, oil
instructions: 1. In a pan, heat oil and add cumin seeds. 2. Add chopped cabbage and green peas, sautéing for a few minutes. 3. Add turmeric and salt, cooking until cabbage is tender. 4. Serve hot as a side dish.

name: Green Smoothie
description: A refreshing and nutritious smoothie packed with greens and fruits for a healthy start to the day.
ingredients: spinach, banana, almond milk, chia seeds, honey
instructions: 1. In a blender, combine spinach, banana, almond milk, and chia seeds. 2. Blend until smooth. 3. Add honey to taste and blend again. 4. Pour into a glass and serve immediately.

name: Turmeric Golden Milk
description: A warm, spiced drink made with turmeric, milk, and honey, known for its anti-inflammatory properties.
ingredients: turmeric powder, milk (dairy or plant-based), black pepper, honey, cinnamon
instructions: 1. In a saucepan, heat milk and stir in turmeric powder, black pepper, and cinnamon. 2. Bring to a simmer, stirring frequently. 3. Sweeten with honey to taste. 4. Serve warm.

name: Detox Water with Lemon and Cucumber
description: A refreshing drink to detoxify the body, infused with lemon and cucumber for flavor.
ingredients: water, lemon slices, cucumber slices, mint leaves
instructions: 1. In a pitcher, combine water, lemon slices, cucumber slices, and mint leaves. 2. Let it infuse for at least 1 hour in the fridge. 3. Serve chilled.

name: Berry Infused Water
description: A fruity and refreshing infused water with mixed berries for a healthy twist.
ingredients: water, mixed berries (strawberries, blueberries, raspberries)
instructions: 1. In a pitcher, add water and mixed berries. 2. Let it infuse for 30 minutes in the fridge. 3. Serve chilled.

name: Ginger Tea
description: A warm, soothing tea made with fresh ginger, great for digestion and relaxation.
ingredients: water, fresh ginger, honey, lemon juice
instructions: 1. Boil water in a saucepan. 2. Add sliced ginger and simmer for 10 minutes. 3. Strain into a cup and add honey and lemon juice to taste. 4. Serve warm.

name: Mint Lemonade
description: A refreshing drink made with fresh mint, lemon, and sugar, perfect for hot days.
ingredients: water, lemon juice, fresh mint leaves, sugar
instructions: 1. In a pitcher, combine water, lemon juice, sugar, and fresh mint leaves. 2. Stir until sugar is dissolved. 3. Serve over ice.

name: Coconut Water with Lime
description: A hydrating drink made with fresh coconut water and a splash of lime juice.
ingredients: coconut water, lime juice, mint leaves
instructions: 1. In a glass, combine coconut water and lime juice. 2. Stir and garnish with mint leaves. 3. Serve chilled.

name: Beetroot Juice
description: A vibrant and nutrient-rich juice made with fresh beetroot, known for its health benefits.
ingredients: beetroot, apple, lemon, ginger
instructions: 1. Peel and chop beetroot, apple, and ginger. 2. Blend with lemon juice and strain. 3. Serve chilled.

name: Carrot and Orange Juice
description: A sweet and tangy juice combining the flavors of fresh carrots and oranges, rich in vitamin A.
ingredients: carrots, oranges, ginger
instructions: 1. Peel and chop carrots and oranges. 2. Blend with ginger and strain. 3. Serve chilled.

name: Almond Milk
description: A creamy and nutritious plant-based milk made from almonds, perfect for smoothies or on its own.
ingredients: almonds, water, vanilla extract, sweetener (optional)
instructions: 1. Soak almonds in water overnight. 2. Drain and blend with fresh water and vanilla extract. 3. Strain through a nut milk bag. 4. Sweeten if desired and serve.

name: Chia Seed Lemonade
description: A hydrating and nutritious drink made with chia seeds, lemon juice, and water, known for its health benefits.
ingredients: water, chia seeds, lemon juice, honey
instructions: 1. In a glass, mix water, chia seeds, lemon juice, and honey. 2. Stir and let sit for 10 minutes for seeds to expand. 3. Serve chilled.

name: Apple Cider Vinegar Drink
description: A tangy drink made with apple cider vinegar and water, often used for its health benefits.
ingredients: water, apple cider vinegar, honey, lemon juice
instructions: 1. In a glass, combine water, apple cider vinegar, honey, and lemon juice. 2. Stir well and serve.

name: Spinach and Pineapple Smoothie
description: A delicious smoothie combining spinach and pineapple for a nutrient-packed treat.
ingredients: spinach, pineapple, banana, coconut water
instructions: 1. In a blender, combine spinach, pineapple, banana, and coconut water. 2. Blend until smooth. 3. Serve immediately.

name: Herbal Iced Tea
description: A refreshing iced tea made from herbal tea bags, perfect for hot days.
ingredients: herbal tea bags, water, honey, lemon
instructions: 1. Brew herbal tea in hot water and let it cool. 2. Sweeten with honey and add lemon juice. 3. Serve over ice.
